meanings.definition: An instrument used to measure angles of elevation or inclination.
meanings.sent1: The scientists used clinometers to measure the steepness of the mountain slope.
meanings.sent2: She always carries her clinometers when hiking to calculate the angle of the hills.
meanings.sent3: The clinometers at the construction site were having a party, celebrating their accurate readings.
meanings.sent4: His eyes were like clinometers, always assessing the incline of the terrain around him.
meanings.sent5: The students learned how to use clinometers by practicing on different surfaces.

meanings.definition: A tool for determining the angle of a slope or the height of an object.
meanings.sent1: The builders relied on clinometers to find out the steepness of the roof.
meanings.sent2: During the survey, they used clinometers to measure the height of the tower.
meanings.sent3: The clinometers in the toolbox were arguing about who was the most accurate.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted like a clinometer, always pointing her towards the right decision.
meanings.sent5: The explorer's clinometers helped him navigate through the rugged terrain.
